FAQ.title: Frequently Asked
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about StreamVox
FAQ.a1: StreamVox is an AI-powered real-time translator for Windows. It adds live subtitles to calls, meetings, videos, streams, and mobile calls, so you can understand people in other languages instantly.
FAQ.q2: Can I watch anime without subtitles using StreamVox?
FAQ.a2: Yes! StreamVox is perfect for anime fans. You can watch raw anime, Japanese streams, or any content in Japanese (or 10+ other languages) and get real-time translated subtitles directly on your screen. No need to wait for fansubs.
FAQ.q3: Does StreamVox work with Crunchyroll, Netflix, and other streaming services?
FAQ.a3: StreamVox works with any video player or streaming service on your Windows PC. It captures system audio and displays translated subtitles in an overlay on top of any app - including Crunchyroll, Netflix, YouTube, Twitch, and more.
FAQ.a4: StreamVox supports 10+ languages including English, Japanese, Russian, German, Spanish, French, Chinese, Korean, Portuguese, and Italian. Perfect for anime, international gaming, and global meetings.
FAQ.q5: Can I use StreamVox for phone calls?
FAQ.a5: Yes! Connect your iPhone or Android to Windows using Microsoft Phone Link, and StreamVox will display live subtitles for your phone calls directly on your PC screen.
FAQ.q6: Does StreamVox work with Zoom, Teams, and Discord?
FAQ.a6: Absolutely. StreamVox translates live conversations in Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, Skype, Discord, and any other communication app. Follow colleagues and friends in your own language.
FAQ.a7: Yes! Gamers love StreamVox for translating in-game voice chat, Japanese visual novels, and international Twitch streams. Get real-time subtitles without pausing your gameplay.
FAQ.q8: Is StreamVox helpful for hard-of-hearing users?
FAQ.a8: StreamVox can be very helpful for people who have difficulty hearing speech. Live on-screen subtitles make calls, meetings, and videos easier to follow. Note: StreamVox is not a medical device.
FAQ.a9: No. StreamVox is privacy-focused. Audio is processed in real-time for translation and is never stored on any servers. Your conversations remain private.
FAQ.a10: StreamVox is optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11 (64-bit). It features a modern dark-mode interface designed for the latest Windows experience.
FAQ.q11: Is the StreamVox interface available in my language?
FAQ.a11: Yes! The StreamVox app interface is available in 8 languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, Chinese, Japanese, German, French, and Russian. You can switch languages in the app settings.
FAQ.q12: How does the overlay feature work?
FAQ.a12: StreamVox displays subtitles in a floating overlay window that stays on top of any application. You can customize font size (12-72px), text color, transparency, and position. Your preferences are saved automatically between sessions.
FAQ.a13: Yes! StreamVox Free lets you translate up to 20 minutes per day. StreamVox Pro ($5.99/month) provides unlimited translation time for power users.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.dataCollectionText: StreamVox processes audio data in real-time to provide translation services. This audio data is processed transiently and is NOT stored on our servers.
Privacy.paymentText: We do not compromise your payment information. All payments are securely processed by our Merchant of Record, Paddle.com, or the Microsoft Store.
Privacy.paddleText: StreamVox uses Paddle (https://paddle.com) as an alternative payment provider alongside Microsoft Store IAP. When using Paddle payments, Paddle collects your email, billing address, and payment method details. Paddle processes payments as the Merchant of Record and follows their own Privacy Policy (https://paddle.com/legal/privacy). No payment data is stored by StreamVox. You can choose Microsoft Store billing instead, in which case no data is shared with Paddle.
Privacy.thirdPartyText: We use trusted third-party providers for speech-to-text processing (e.g., Deepgram, OpenAI) to ensure high accuracy. These providers are bound by strict data privacy agreements.
